ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Wind velocity obtained by meteor radar at Bear Island, Svalbard
ResourceHeader.Description: Wind velocity between 80 and 100 km from November 2007 to April 2011 obtained by meteor radar at Bear Island, Svalbard. For detail of the instrument, please look into Nozawa et al. (JASTP, 2012). The full reference is Nozawa, S., C.M. Hall, M. Tsutsumi, A. Brekke, Y. Ogawa, T. T. Tsuda, S. Oyama, R. Fujii, Mean winds, tides, and quasi-2 day waves above Bear Island, JASTP, 90-91, 26-44, 2012.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: The data are available only for scientific research use. The meteor radar has been operated under collabrations between ISEE, Nagoya University and TGO, University of Tromsoe, Please contact the Principal Investigator (Satonori NOZAWA, nozawa at isee.nagoya-u.ac.jp) for the details.

AccessURL.Name: Website of the Bear Island meter radar, ISEE, Nagoya University
AccessURL.Description: Mesospheric wind data obtained by a meteor radar at Bear island, Norway.
